intro: Phaeostoma douglasii, commonly known as the Douglas's false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces a single, tall flowering stalk that bears small, greenish-white flowers clustered in a dense umbel. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a distinct, often hairy stem. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes.
